roleset.name: move quickly
roleset.note: ZOOM-V NOTES: Frames file for 'zoom' based on sentences in the WSJ corpus and comparison with 'climb' (from zoom.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: with end point
example.text: He believes [0] Jaguar 's share price could zoom to between # 8 and # 10 [*U*]( $ 12.60 to $ 15.80 [*U*] ) .

example.name: with EXT
example.text: A minute later it soared 128 points , then zoomed back down 113 points , 69 below Friday 's close .
example.arg: back down 113 points , 69 below Friday 's close

example.name: intransitive
example.text: But put-option prices may zoom when trading resumes today [*T*-1] .

roleset.name: change the detail with which an image is viewed, for the larger or the smaller; non-VPC
roleset.note: ZOOM-V NOTES: Added by Julia for Google. It might seems strange to combine shrinking and enlarging into a single roleset, but sometimes it is actually not clear which type of zooming is occurring.

role.descr: agent, entity making arg1 larger or smaller
thing zoomed in or out- screen, display, device
zoomed in on or from what- image enlarged or shrunk

example.name: zoom-v
example.text: For me (and my learners) one of the most valuable features of the iPad is my-1 ability *PRO*-1 to zoom the screen while presenting.

example.name: zoom-v: args 0, 1, 3, 4
example.text: And, *T*-1 can set/force aspect resolutions as i wish, can zoom the screen from 100% to 80% (80% is the best for me).

example.name: zoom-v: args 0, 1, 2
example.text: Can you zoom the screen from the video of the screen captures or do you need to do this before you import into flash?
example.arg: from the video of the screen captures

roleset.name: look at a small section in larger detail
roleset.note: ZOOM_IN-V NOTES: Added by Julia for clarity.

role.descr: thing zoomed in- screen, display, device
zoomed in on what- image enlarged

example.name: zoom_in-v
example.text: What this does is, by hitting a key combination, it will zoom the screen in on the area you're looking at.
example.arg: on the area you're looking at

roleset.name: look at a larger section with less detail
roleset.note: ZOOM_OUT-V NOTES: Added by Julia for clarity.

role.descr: thing zoomed in- screen, dispaly, device
zoomed out from what- image shrunk

example.name: zoom_out-v
example.text: The Zoom Out tool is used *PRO* to zoom the view out from a map, click on a location on the map, and the zoom level will increase to double the current level.
